content: 5 stitches single_crochet for 10 stitches ch1 and reverse down other side of leaf row2 ch1 add sm along length to divide stitch type sections work remaining stitches along row 1 in the following order single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet at the top chain work 3 double_crochet and then continue down the other side of the leaf in reverse order fasten_off and change colour for my leaf i worked chain 1 single_crochet for 5 stitches half_double_crochet for 10 stitches double_crochet until 25 stitches from top of leaf half_double_crochet for 15 stitches single_crochet for 10 stitches then 3 double_crochet into turning chain and reversed down the other side of leaf row 3 chain on new lighter colour at leaf base work remaining stitches along row 2 in the following order single_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch to top at the top middle stitch work double_crochet and then continue down the other side of the leaf in reverse order fasten_off and weave in ends for my leaf i worked ch1 single_crochet for 20 stitches half_double_crochet until 20 stitches before the top single_crochet for 15 stitches slip_stitch to top middle chain double_crochet then reverse order down other side of leaf repeat this pattern for all leaves required i worked a total of 5 leaves odd numbers of leaves seem to look best potting up your work to create a stable base within the pot to display the snake plant i used lengths of felt cut to a height about 2 cm shorter than the pot and rolled them into a fat sausage as i rolled i inserted the leaves the finished sausage of leaves and felt fitted snugly into the pot i then topped off the felt soil with decorative stones because nothing is affixed permanently i can change the look of the plant over time but if you want you could glue or stitch the leaves to the felt and then glue the felt sausage into the pot and finally enjoy your new low maintenance plant
